intro: Goeppertia elliptica, commonly known as the Zebra Plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Marantaceae family and is characterized by its striking, mottled leaves with a distinctive zebra-like pattern. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. Its leaves are broad and elliptical, with a waxy texture and a vibrant green color. Goeppertia elliptica is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively low maintenance requirements.
